intro: Tithymalus calyptratus, commonly known as the hooded gentian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which are typically tubular in shape and attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. The plant belongs to the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue or purple flowers. Tithymalus calyptratus thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem.
